title: Complementary therapies
author: Parkinson's Europe
description: Many people with Parkinson's seem to find complementary therapies helpful, especially for relaxation and to reduce stress and depression.
cleaned_text: Related reading Articles from Parkinson's Life online magazine - "How [complementary medicines](http://parkinsonslife.eu/how-complementary-medicines-can-help-those-living-with-parkinsons/)can help those living with Parkinson's" Many people with Parkinson's are interested in complementary therapies such as acupuncture, aromatherapy and herbal medicine. These non-conventional treatments are often based on centuries-old techniques. Although there is little scientific evidence about their use as a form of Parkinson's therapy, many people with the condition seem to find complementary therapy techniques helpful, especially for relaxation and to reduce stress and depression. This section provides a guide to complementary therapies in general as well as specific techniques that people with Parkinson's have tried. Always consult your doctor before trying any form of complementary therapy. Depending on how Parkinson's affects you, some techniques may not be suitable, and some herbal medicines could react badly with medicines used to treat Parkinson's.
